page.title: 02Walks around Hampton
page.content: There is a splendid walk down the fields by{Eastcote Lane.}There is a stream about two metres wide and by it a piece of rope tied to a tree. You can hold the rope and swing across. Another lane leads to the{River Blythe and a lake. Down this lane the railway goes over a bridge known as the {"Cuckoo Bridge".}If you go under it and turn right you will see a footpath which leads to woodland. There are quite a few animals there. On the right, before the river, you can walk to a lake. There are swans, geese and an island of grass in the middle. In the summer people swim in the lake. There is a smaller lake near it which has fish and frogs, also an island in the middle but the water is slimy.
